notesStmt.note: Large infills at inner end, lost adhesion.
Severe cockling and pleats obscuring text.
Ink flaking. Carbon ink granular, with losses from damp.
Water-damaged (ink offset to verso from damp).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 82; ruled lines: 48; written lines: 48; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point. Visible pricking and stiching. 82 columns in total, one to four columns per membrane. Three tagin on the letters שעטנזגץ, and one on בדהי. The letter ח is arched throughout, and פ' לפוף is very frequent. Several instances of majuscular and minuscular letters. Special shapes of the letters ם, ה, ו, י. The "puncta extraordinaria" occur in Num. 3:39, 9:10, and 21:30. No inverted nun placed before and after Num. 10:35-36. Every column begins with a new verse, and the initial letter is always ו, with the exception of Gen. 1:1, 5:1, and 13 other instances.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script of the 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Bequeathed to the British Museum by Rev. J. Noble Coleman on 25 May 1872: inscribed on verso.
